description:
Course Description:

Learn the easiest and basic method to work with SAP Crystal Reports 2013 in Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 connected to MS SQL Server 2008 Database.

Let's make the first move to design & display one simple Crystal Report for the professional presentation of data in a web browser, in a manner that could be used for decision making by the management.

Course Specialty:

This course will help software developers to get rid-off writing complex & lengthy code for displaying Crystal Report in a web browser. This course demonstrates a "Developers-Friendly" method of:-

  • adding Crystal Reports to Microsoft Visual Studio Project,
  • Connecting the report to the Database.
  • working with the layout interface of Crystal Report Designer and
  • using the "Crystal Report Viewer Control" in ASP.Net.

Software/s and their versions used in this course:

  1. Software: SAP Crystal Reports 2013, Developers Version
  2. Platform: Microsoft Visual Studio 2012
  3. Framework: ASP.Net 4.5
  4. Language: C #
  5. Database: Microsoft SQL Server 2008


Contents and Overview:

In only one hour duration with only five videos this course covers most of the SAP Crystal Reports essentials, fundamentals and terminologies along with the best practice of passing structured Query to retrieve data from the database.

In this course you will see how easy it is to use the Graphical User Interface of SAP Crystal Report for placing data chunks into proper sections of the report.

You will also learn to summarize data by inserting "running-total" fields into the report.

In order to display the report, this course provides a short programming code written in C#, which is easy, tested and error free.

Upon completion you will be able to design any type of report on your own and will be working independently with both Microsoft Visual Studio and SAP Crystal Reports.

What are the requirements?

  • Basic knowledge of programming in C#
  • A familiarity of Microsoft Visual Studio
  • Concepts of database tables & views
  • General knowledge of Web Applications

At the end of this course you will be able to:

  • Create & configure a DataSet Object in Microsoft Visual Studio 2012
  • Add a blank Crystal report to the project
  • Bind the Crystal report with the DataSet
  • Design & Format the Crystal report
  • Add a WebForm to the project
  • Drag & drop a Button & a CrystalReportViewer control on the WebForm
  • Add C# code behind the Button Click event to display the report in browser


What is the target audience?

  • Students of Software Engineering
  • University students who are working on their final year project
  • Database Applications Developers, Internees and students
  • Web Developers
  • E.R.P Developers
  • Database Administrators
  • IT professionals and managers whose job is to implement SAP ERP systems in their organizations
title: SAP Crystal Reports with ASP.Net (Step by step)
